text: Acalypha suirenbiensis is a species of plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is endemic to Hualien County, Taiwan. The Flora of China, however, includes Acalypha hontauyuensis from Orchid Island in this species. It is a shrub growing about tall. ==Habitat and conservation== Acalypha suirenbiensis grows near the seashore in thickets, below asl. It is confined to a single location and is vulnerable to habitat loss. ==References== suirenbiensis Category:Endemic flora of Taiwan Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Acalypha suirenbiensis
